RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 44. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: JUBAY chased the pace inside, rounded the turn at the rail then angled to the outside of BOO TOO leaving the turn, dug in for the lead late stretch and raced clear approaching the wire. The latter took the lead leaving the chute and rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the quarter pole, raced at the rail on the turn, was caught in late stretch but held on for second. METALLIC CAT gave chase, raced close in the two and three paths on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CHARTERED COURSE chased outside, rounded the turn about the four path, drifted leaving the turn and passed some rivals widest. GETTIN SPICY gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn off the rail and showed little in the lane. TO THE TOP saved ground. TOTHETRAINSTATION was only briefly close while giving chase then faded off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Jubay
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased inside,angled off rail 1/8,up late,clear near wire

ENTRY.NAME: Metallic Cat
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 7800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE AUGUST 17, 2022. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since August 17, 2022 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $4,000 (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CLOSE THE CASE drew clear and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was given rein to move away leaving the three eighths pole, came under pressure at the rail through the far turn, extended his lead through later yards but was unsaddled on the clubhouse turn and returned sore. NO FOOLING DUDE stalked the early pace two deep while between horses, gave chase approaching the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and cleared second past the eighth pole. FORT FORTITUDE stalked inside on the first turn, picked up the chase leaving the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn about the four path and finished evenly to take third later yards. SUPERHIGHWAY stalked four wide on the opening turn, challenged leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened inside the eighth pole. GAMING JACK stalked three wide on the first turn, gave chase toward the three eighths pole but weakened off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: No Fooling Dude
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Ronney W and Conrad Randall R

ENTRY.NAME: Fort Fortitude
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,chased 3/8,4p far turn,along 3rd later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Close the Case
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,given rein 3/8,pressured turn,walked off sore

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 88. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Three Races Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight All owances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: AMIDSHIPS was hustled along inside and took the nod at the five sixteenths pole, inched clear into the lane and was steadily handled to hold on. JEFFERSON NATIVE veered out leaving the gate then contested the early pace, raced close three wide on the turn and dueled through the stretch to earn the nod for second. CARIBBEAN PLEASURE contested the early pace between horses, dropped back into the lane and missed the nod in the stretch duel for second. RIVER CROSROAD RVF chased inside, rounded the turn at the rail and ran evenly in the lane. BRISTOL CHANNEL chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and ran evenly in the stretch. SUPER JORDAN gave chase through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. BALI'S SHADE was forced outward leaving the gate, gave chase outside, raced in the six path on the turn and showed little in the lane. DEE'S WISEGUY broke through the gate prior the start, gave chase through the backstretch but weakened off the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Dee's Wiseguy
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke through prior,chased,weakened off rail turn

ENTRY.NAME: Bali's Shade
ENTRY.COMMENT: forced out break,chased outside,6p turn,empty lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 45. Maiden Claiming Purse 13000. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500, if for $7,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CURB THAT TIGER saved ground racing well back, started a bid approaching the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn at the rail, angled to the three path into the lane, dug in for the lead just inside the sixteenth pole and held well under steady handling. DENIZETTI rated close inside, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in range in the three path on the turn, drifted into the lane then dueled for second late yards. COLONIAL ROAD raced off the rail on the opening turn then eased out entering the backstretch, bid nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four and five paths on the far turn, left the turn outside and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. KING OF LUCK rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the seven sixteenths pole, kept the advantage off the rail on the far turn, lugged in under right hand urging mid-stretch and was immediately taken up. ASTRAYAL saved ground on the opening turn, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and was roughed at the inside flank of King Of Luck mid-stretch. I SEE NOTHING was reluctant to load then settled back in the two and three paths, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn and showed little more. JUBA'S MOCHA stalked from the four path the first turn, gave chase leaving the three eighths pole but weakened into the far turn. JUBA'S YANKEE ONE exchanged contact with BANK CARD leaving the gate then stalked off the rail the first turn, gave chase leaving the half mile pole but faded through the backstretch. The latter exchanged contact with Juba's Yankee One leaving the gate and dropped well back. After a Stewards inquiry and subsequent claim of foul against the rider of King Of Luck for interference in mid-stretch, lodged by the rider of Astrayal, the Stewards disqualified the former to fifth place.

ENTRY.NAME: dq-King of Luck
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace,pressured 7/16,off rail turn,lugged in 1/16,taken up

ENTRY.NAME: Curb That Tiger
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,bid 3/8,rail far turn,3p 1/8,up inside1/16,held well

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 7F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 18600. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000, if for $12,500, allowed 2 lbs. (Races Whe re Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERSONABLE stalked inside then challenged nearing the three eighths pole, took the lead past the pole, dueled clear at the rail toward the head of the lane and held well under steady handling. NO LOVE FOR JUBA settled off the rail on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and bid past the seven sixteenths pole, raced close off the rail on the far turn but dropped back approaching the head of the lane, though, held on for second. ROAD SLEW raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn, bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and finished evenly while gaining on the runner-up. MR CHANCE ROMANCE rounded the first turn about the three path, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced four wide on the far turn and showed little further. MODERN DAY ROMANCE rated close off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase nearing the five sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn then flattened in the lane. NEVERPOPTHECORK saved ground on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and showed little response through the backstretch. ORANGEBURG rated close off the rail on the opening turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but weakened in the three path of the far turn. WELL EQUIPPED saved ground on the first turn and showed little response. CHARITABLE WINDSOR tapered in and took the lead toward the three eighths pole then rated the pace, came under pressure nearing the three eighths, was met past the pole, gave chase from that point but weakened approaching the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Road Slew
ENTRY.COMMENT: well off pace,bid 7/16,off rail far turn,even finish,gain on 2nd

ENTRY.NAME: Charitable Windsor
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,met past 3/8,chased,weakened near far turn

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Special Weight Purse 26500. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: GOLD FIBER became a bit anxious in the gate then bobbled at the break, gave chase through the backstretch and steadily progressed, rounded the turn about the four path then dug in under steady encouragement and got up the final yards. B. J. MOOSE pressured the early pace then took the nod approaching the five sixteenths pole, raced clear at the rail into the turn, dug in leaving the turn but was caught in the final yards. KARMA BUS gave chase through the backstretch, raced close at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. CALYPSO JOHN chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the four path and ran evenly in the stretch. EL PACHO set a pressured early pace, was met approaching the five sixteenths pole and gave chase from that point, but dropped back off the rail into the turn and weakened leaving the turn. RAISE A RUCKUS chased through the backstretch, raced in the four path on the turn and showed little in the lane. ALL ROADS TO DENIS was not a factor. DOG TOWN ALLEN gave chase then faded at the rail on the turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Fiber
ENTRY.COMMENT: anxious gate,bobbled break,chased,4p turn,up final yards

ENTRY.NAME: Karma Bus
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: El Pacho
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,met near 5/16,chased,weakened into lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 75. Allowance Purse 28400. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since June 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15, 000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DUNCAN IDAHO took the lead passing the half mile pole and kept the edge over El Lucerito through the backstretch, dueled clear of that one approaching the eighth pole and was kept sharp through the lane. TEACHINTHERELEASE gave chase through the backstretch, raced at a close disadvantage three wide on the turn then dueled for second. EL LUCERITO engaged in close chase and contested with a slim disadvantage two deep on the turn, but relented in the stretch duel for second. COLT ROCK gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. BERTRAM FLIGHT gave chase, raced at the rail on the turn and finished evenly. JUBA BOUND chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path and showed little in the lane. ELEANORS JACK gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Duncan Idaho
ENTRY.COMMENT: up past 1/2,kept edge,dueled clear toward 1/8,kept sharp lane

ENTRY.NAME: El Lucerito
ENTRY.OWNER: Campbell Marshall T and Bentley Donald L

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Claiming Purse 10800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since July 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs. NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: POWER AGENDA moved to the inside and rated the pace, kept the advantage over Motivated Speaker leaving the three eighths pole, was urged away at the rail on the far turn and extended his lead under a vigorous hand ride. VOICE OF NOW raced boxed at the rail on the opening turn then settled close into the backstretch, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn in the three path, drifted leaving the turn but dug in through the stretch and took second the final stride. HERE AND NOFURTHER rounded the first turn about the four path, started a three wide bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn then flattened later yards. URBAN BANDIT saved ground on the first turn, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced at the rail on the far turn then flattened mid-stretch. SUMMER ASH raced well off the pace and off the rail on the first turn, eased out leaving the turn and gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, improved in the six path of the far turn but showed little further. COUNTRY CHARLIE settled off the rail on the first turn then eased out leaving the turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, angled to the rail midway on the far turn and passed rivals. SPARKLING SHIRE entered the first turn in the five path, gave chase toward the seven sixteenths pole but flattened in the four path of the far turn. DANNY'S WINKSTER saved ground on the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MOTIVATED SPEAKER stalked the early pace two deep, gave chase nearing the three eighths pole but faded toward the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Voice of Now
ENTRY.COMMENT: boxed rail 1st turn,settled close,chased 3/8,3p turn,up 2nd late

ENTRY.NAME: Country Charlie
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,angled in far turn,pass rivals

ENTRY.NAME: Here and Nofurther
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4p 1st turn,3wd bid 3/8,off rail far turn,flattened later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Summer Ash
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,eased out 1/2,chased 7/16,6p far turn,empty lane

ENTRY.NAME: Power Agenda
ENTRY.OWNER: Pleasant Fields at Harmony Hill LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,urged away rail turn,vigorous hand ride
